Every spring, a few hundred fishermen in Maine have a chance to make a lot of money in a short period of time by fishing for baby eels - or elvers, as they're called.

As Maine Public radio's Nora Flaherty reports, that long journey starts in the dark of night on a very cold river.

I'm making a steady current, and they get washed into the current, and then I pick them up with the next swoop.
Elvers hatch in the Atlantic.
